instruction: What is the total number of credits required to graduate with a BBA from EWU?
response: You need to complete a minimum of 123 credits to earn your Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) degree at East West University.

instruction: How are the BBA credits distributed across different course categories?
response: The 123-credit BBA program is structured as follows: 24 credits in compulsory general education, 9 credits in optional general education, 60 credits in core business courses, 18 credits in major-specific courses, 9 credits in open electives, and 3 credits for an internship or project.

instruction: How many credits are dedicated to general education in the BBA program?
response: The BBA program includes 33 credits of general education: 24 credits are compulsory (required for all students), and 9 credits are optional, allowing you to explore subjects outside your major.

instruction: What is the credit requirement for the internship or project in the BBA program?
response: You must complete a 3-credit internship or project as part of your BBA degree requirements. This practical component helps you gain real-world business experience before graduation.

instruction: Can I take courses outside of business as a BBA student?
response: Yes! The program includes 9 credits of open electives, which you can use to take courses in any departmentsuch as computer science, economics, or communicationbased on your interests or career goals.

instruction: How many credits are focused specifically on my business major?
response: Youll take 18 credits of major-specific courses, which allow you to deepen your expertise in a particular area of business, such as marketing, finance, or management, depending on available specializations.

instruction: What portion of the BBA curriculum is made up of core business courses?
response: Core business courses form the backbone of the program, totaling 60 credits. These cover essential topics like accounting, finance, marketing, operations, organizational behavior, and strategic management.

instruction: Do I have flexibility in choosing general education courses?
response: Yes, while 24 credits of general education are compulsory (likely covering English, math, and social sciences), you have 9 credits of optional general education where you can choose from a range of approved courses to fulfill breadth requirements.

instruction: Is an internship mandatory for BBA students at EWU?
response: Yes, the program requires a 3-credit internship or project, which is part of the 123 total credits needed for graduation. This ensures you gain hands-on professional experience in a business setting.

instruction: How many elective credits do BBA students get?
response: BBA students have a total of 18 elective credits: 9 in optional general education and 9 in open electives. This gives you room to explore interdisciplinary subjects or pursue a minor alongside your business degree.

instruction: How many credits do I need to complete for my major in the BBA program at EWU?
response: All BBA majors at East West University require exactly 18 credits to complete. This includes a combination of required courses and elective courses specific to your chosen majorsuch as Accounting, Finance, Marketing, HRM, MIS, Management, or International Business.

instruction: What are the required courses for the Accounting major?
response: The Accounting major requires four courses (12 credits): Taxation (ACT311), Intermediate Accounting I (ACT411), Intermediate Accounting II (ACT421), and Cost Accounting (ACT441). Youll also need to take 6 credits (2 courses) from the major electives to reach the 18-credit requirement.

instruction: Can Finance students take Taxation as part of their major?
response: Yes! 'Taxation' (ACT311) is listed as a major elective for Finance students. As long as youve completed the prerequisite (ACT101), you can choose it as one of your Finance major electives.

instruction: How many required courses are there in the Marketing major?
response: The Marketing major has only 2 required courses: Consumer Behavior (MKT410) and Marketing Research (MKT414). The remaining 12 credits (4 courses) come from a wide selection of 8 major electives like Brand Management, Digital Marketing, and Supply Chain Management.

instruction: Whats the prerequisite for Intermediate Accounting I?
response: To enroll in Intermediate Accounting I (ACT411), you must have already completed ACT201 (likely Principles of Accounting II). This ensures you have the foundational accounting knowledge needed for advanced topics.

instruction: Does the MIS major include programming courses?
response: Yes, the MIS (Management Information Systems) major includes several technical courses. Required courses include Structural Programming (MIS401) and System Analysis and Design, while electives like Object-Oriented Programming, Web Programming, and Database Systems provide strong programming and systems development skills.

instruction: What courses are required for the HRM major?
response: HRM majors must take three required courses: Human Resource Planning (HRM411), Compensation Management (HRM412), and Industrial Relations and Labour Law (HRM413). All require HRM301 as a prerequisite, and youll choose 3 more electives from 7 options to complete the 18-credit major.

instruction: Is International Financial Management offered in more than one major?
response: Yes! 'International Financial Management' appears as a required course in both the Finance major (FIN465) and the International Business major (ITB465), reflecting its importance in global business and finance curricula.

instruction: Can I take International Marketing if Im a Marketing major?
response: Yes, 'International Marketing' (MKT408) is a major elective for Marketing students. Youll need to have completed MKT201 and ITB301 as prerequisites before enrolling.

instruction: What are the prerequisites for the Leadership Management course?
response: To take 'Leadership Management' (MGT465) in the Management major, you must first complete MGT251 (likely Organizational Behavior or a similar foundational management course).

instruction: How many elective courses do I need to choose in the Finance major?
response: The Finance major has 3 required courses (9 credits), so you need to select 3 more courses (9 credits) from a list of 8 major electivessuch as Financial Institutions, Risk Management, Real Estate Finance, or Options and Futuresto meet the 18-credit major requirement.

instruction: Are there any entrepreneurship-related courses in the BBA program?
response: Yes! 'Entrepreneurship Development' (MGT421) is a required course for Management majors, and 'Small Business Management' (MGT437) is an elective in the same majorboth ideal for students interested in starting or managing their own businesses.

instruction: What technical skills will I gain in the MIS major?
response: The MIS major equips you with programming (Structural and Object-Oriented), database management (RDBMS, SQL), networking, system analysis, web development (E-Commerce), and security skillspreparing you for roles at the intersection of business and technology.

instruction: Is there a course on labor laws in the BBA program?
response: Yes, 'Industrial Relations and Labour Law' (HRM413) is a required course for HRM majors, covering legal frameworks, worker rights, and employer obligations in Bangladesh and international contexts.

instruction: Can Management students take courses related to globalization?
response: Yes, 'Managing Globalization' (MGT448) is a major elective for Management students, with ITB301 as a prerequisite. It explores how global trends impact business strategy, operations, and leadership.

instruction: Whats the difference between required and elective courses in my major?
response: Required courses are mandatory for all students in that major and form the core knowledge base. Electives let you specialize furthere.g., a Finance student can focus on banking, investments, or risk management based on their career goals.

instruction: Do I need programming experience before joining the MIS major?
response: While prior experience isnt required, youll need to complete foundational courses like CSE102 and MIS101 first. The major builds progressivelyfrom structural programming to advanced topics like system security and e-commerce development.

instruction: Are there courses on digital marketing or branding in the BBA program?
response: Yes! Marketing majors can take 'Brand Management' (MKT416) and 'Integrated Marketing Communication' (MKT402). While not explicitly labeled 'digital marketing,' 'E-Commerce and Web Programming' (MIS419) and 'IMC' cover relevant digital strategies.

instruction: Can HRM students learn about HR software systems?
response: Yes, 'Human Resource Information System' (HRM417) is a major elective for HRM students. It requires MIS101 as a prerequisite and covers how technology supports recruitment, payroll, performance tracking, and compliance.

instruction: What majors offer the most elective choices?
response: Finance offers the most electives with 8 options, followed by Marketing and HRM (7 each). Accounting has 4 electives, while Management and International Business offer 5 each. MIS provides 7 electives, giving students flexibility to tailor their tech-business focus.

instruction: What are the open elective requirements for BBA students at EWU?
response: BBA students must take three 300/400-level courses (9 credits total) as open electives from departments like BA, CSE, ICE, ENG, or ECO. However, ICE 301 (Network Technology) and ICE 403 (Local Area Network) are not allowed. You must meet prerequisites and consult with the relevant department chair and instructor before enrolling.

instruction: Can I take any course as an open elective in my BBA program?
response: Not quite. While you can choose from 300/400-level courses in BA, CSE, ICE, ENG, or ECO departments, two coursesICE 301 and ICE 403are explicitly excluded. Also, you must satisfy prerequisites and get approval from the course instructor and department chair before registration.

instruction: Do I need permission to enroll in open electives from other departments?
response: Yes, you must consult with both the chairperson and the course instructor of the department offering the open elective. This ensures you meet prerequisites and that the course is appropriate for cross-departmental enrollment.

instruction: What is a second major option for non-BBA students at EWU?
response: Non-BBA students can pursue a second major in business by completing 51 credits: 33 credits in core business courses (including economics, accounting, finance, marketing, management, math, and statistics) plus 15 credits in a chosen business major area like Finance, Marketing, or HRM.

instruction: How many credits are required for a second major in business for non-BBA students?
response: A total of 51 credits are required: 33 credits from 11 compulsory core courses (such as Microeconomics, Financial Accounting, and Business Communication) and 15 credits from a selected business major (e.g., ACT, FIN, MKT, HRM, etc.).

instruction: What are the core courses required for a second major in business?
response: The second major requires 11 core courses: Mathematics for Business I & II, Statistics for Business I & II, Microeconomics, Macroeconomics, Financial Accounting, Principles of Finance, Management, Marketing, and Business Communicationtotaling 33 credits.

instruction: After completing core courses, what do I need to do for the second major?
response: After the 33-credit core, you must choose one business area (e.g., Finance, Marketing, HRM) and complete 15 credits of major-specific courses in that field to fulfill the remaining requirement of the 51-credit second major.

instruction: Can I choose any business department for my second major?
response: Yes, you can select from seven major areas: Accounting (ACT), Finance (FIN), International Business (ITB), Management (MGT), MIS, Marketing (MKT), or HRMeach requiring 15 credits of specialized coursework.

instruction: Is there a choice in the second major core requirements?
response: Yes, after completing the 11 fixed core courses, you must take one additional course from a set of options: ACT201, FIN201, MKT201, or MGT251likely aligning with your intended major focus.

instruction: Are open electives the same as general electives in the BBA program?
response: In this context, 'open electives' refer specifically to three 300/400-level courses taken from non-BBA departments (like CSE or ECO), as mandated by university policy. They are distinct from major or general education electives and have special enrollment rules.

instruction: Why cant I take ICE 301 or ICE 403 as open electives?
response: University policy explicitly prohibits BBA students from using ICE 301 (Network Technology) and ICE 403 (Local Area Network) to fulfill open elective requirementslikely because they are highly technical and not aligned with BBA learning outcomes.

instruction: How does the second major policy benefit non-business students?
response: It allows students from other disciplines (e.g., engineering or arts) to gain a structured business education by completing 51 credits across core and major courses, making them more competitive for roles in management, consulting, or entrepreneurship.

instruction: Do I need to declare a second major formally?
response: While the JSON doesnt specify the procedure, completing 51 credits in the defined structure (33 core + 15 major + 1 optional course) implies formal declaration is required to ensure proper advising and credit tracking toward the second major credential.

instruction: Can BBA students pursue a second major in another field?
response: The provided JSON only describes a second major option for non-BBA students wanting to add business. It doesnt mention BBA students adding a second major in, say, CSE or ECOso that option isnt covered in this data.

instruction: What math and stats courses are required for the second major in business?
response: You must take four quantitative courses: Mathematics for Business and Economics I & II (MAT110, MAT211) and Statistics for Business and Economics I & II (ECO104, ECO204)totaling 12 credits as part of the 33-credit core.

instruction: Is Business Communication part of the second major requirements?
response: Yes, 'Business Communication' (BUS231) is one of the 11 compulsory core courses (3 credits) required for the 51-credit second major in business for non-BBA students.

instruction: How many departments can I choose open electives from?
response: You can select open electives from five departments: BA (English/Arts), CSE (Computer Science), ICE (Electrical & Computer Engineering), ENG (possibly English or Engineering), and ECO (Economics)as long as the course is 300/400-level and not ICE 301 or ICE 403.

instruction: What happens if I dont complete the open elective requirement?
response: According to policy, completing three approved 300/400-level open electives is mandatory to qualify for the BBA degree. Failure to fulfill this would prevent you from graduating, even if all other credits are complete.

instruction: Can I take an open elective in Economics?
response: Yes, ECO (Economics) is one of the approved departments for open electives. You can take any 300/400-level ECO course, provided you meet prerequisites and consult with the Economics department chair and instructor beforehand.

instruction: Whats the total credit load if I add a second major as a non-BBA student?
response: The second major itself is 51 credits, but this is in addition to your primary degree requirements. Youll need to complete both your original programs credits and these 51 business credits to earn the second major designation.
